title: LBJ Memorial Grove on the Potomac: Things To Do
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do             Things To Do       Ranger-led Programs To request a ranger-led program at the Memorial Grove call 703‑289‑2553.      Outdoor Activities Bicycling Trails through the meadow at the park and the paved multi-use Mount Vernon Trail, which passes through the park, are flat, car-free places to bicycle. Canoeing or Kayaking An easy flat water paddle through the Boundary Channel is the best way to see how the Potomac River shapes the park. Hiking Easy hikes are available on trails through the grove and meadow. Picnicking There are picnic tables in the meadow. Wildlife Viewing Birders will find habitat for wading birds, raptors, and warblers near the Boundary Channel and in the meadow. Walking or Running Trails through the meadow and the paved multi-use Mount Vernon Trail, which passes through the park are flat, paved places to run or walk.
